devdoc.author: Rafael Cordero
devdoc.details: Includes additional functionality that is not part of ERC20 standard

approve(address,uint256).details: Function will revert if transaction originates from a bad address

contractBalance().return: The ETH balance of this contract in Wei

primaryTransfer(uint256).details: Function will revert if contract state is not ForSaleFunction will revert amount sent does not cover the purchase priceFunction will revert if event creator does not have enough tickets to cover the sale
primaryTransfer(uint256).return: The amount of Eth in Wei returned to ticket buyer as a uint

transfer(address,uint256).details: Function will revert if sender does not have sufficient ticketsFunction will revert if number of tickets to transfer is not a positive numberFunction will revert if transaction originates from a bad address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Function will revert if sender does not have sufficient ticketsFunction will revert if receiver does not have sufficient ticket allowanceFunction will revert if number of tickets to transfer is not a positive numberFunction will revert if transaction originates from a bad address

devdoc.title: Creates a contract that represents General Admission tickets using the ERC20 standard

approve(address,uint256).notice: msg.sender approves an amount of their tokens that can be transferred by second accountto third account to be specified in "transferFrom()"Second and third accounts can be the same addresse.g. msg.sender approves an exchange to transfer some of its tokens to a buyer

methods.constructor: Constructor function that asks for ticket name, symbol, initial quantity and initial price, and address of event creatorGives the entire balance of tickets created to the event creator

contractBalance().notice: Simple function to determine the ETH balance of this contractNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

primaryTransfer(uint256).notice: Allowance amount defined by "allowance[_from][msg.sender]" must be establishedPerforms a ticket transfer from event creator to ticket buyerReturns any amount of overpaymentNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

setToEnded().notice: Changes the state of the contract to EndedNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

setToForSale().notice: Changes the state of the contract to ForSaleNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

setToPaused().notice: Changes the state of the contract to PausedNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

setToPresale().notice: Changes the state of the contract to PreSaleNOT part of ERC20Interface/Standard

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfers _value amount of tokens from msg.sender to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfers tokens from one account "_from" to second account "_to" by a third account ("msg.sender")Second and third accounts can be the same addressThird account must be approved by first account i.e. first account's tokens that will be transferredAllowance amount defined by "allowance[_from][msg.sender]" must be established

userdoc.notice: This contract executes the initial sale of tickets, i.e. the Primary Market
